data.title: Byblos
data.text: Byblos also known as Jbeil or Jubayl is a city in the Keserwan Jbeil Governorate of Lebanon It is believed to have been first occupied between 8800 and 7000BC and continuously inhabited since 5000BC making it one of the oldest continuously inhabited cities in the world During its history Byblos was part of numerous civilizations including Egyptian Phoenician Assyrian Persian Hellenistic Roman Fatimid Genoese Mamluk and Ottoman The city is a UNESCO World Heritage Site
